Look for pi in the world - in a river, for instance. @Myallergyboy If there is a possibility that a product contains an allergen, the allergen would be included as ‚ÄòMay Contains‚Äô under the ingredient list. If it is not listed, there is no risk of cross-contamination. Peas are not included in this list as well.

@Myallergyboy Celery (and celeriac), Mustard, Sesame, Sulphur dioxide (is a preservative found in some dried fruit), Lupin, Molluscs (clams, mussels, whelks, oysters, snails and squid).  If any allergen is present in a product it will be bolded in the ingredient list.

@Myallergyboy Grains containing gluten (wheat, rye, barley), Crustaceans, for example prawns, crabs, lobster and crayfish, Eggs, Fish
Peanuts, Soybeans, Milk (Lactose), Nuts (almonds, hazelnuts, walnuts, pecan nuts, Brazil nuts, pistachio, cashew and macadamia (Queensland) nuts),

@DK25769559 We care deeply about what we put in our food and safety is our number one priority when it comes to our cereals. We use small amounts of TSP in some of our cereals to help improve flavor, color development and texture of each cereal piece . TSP and TKP are different ingredients.

@DK25769559 Hi! Tripotassium Phosphate (TKP) is a water-soluble mineral sourced salt often used to blend ingredients like oil and water. It provides texture to foods, and also helps control cereal dough acidity.  TSP is a type of salt and can be found in a wide variety of food products.(1/2)

iSpace can track up to 300,000 objects in Earth's orbit. If a single one behaves outside of its norm ‚Äî by changing a rotational pattern, for example ‚Äî operators are alerted. https://t.co/balC7pwgVT
Another critical system is iSpace, a modernized version of the first system ever used to track space debris.

Here are some ways to help reduce the risk of heat stroke this #summer:
‚õ±Ô∏è Go to a shady location or a room with air conditioning.
